intro: Crepidorhopalon involucratus, commonly known as the velvetleaf. This plant is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. It produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in terminal inflorescences. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in moist, disturbed habitats. Its fibrous roots and robust growth make it a common weed in agricultural fields.
